intro: Homalium pedicellatum, commonly known as the red-fruited evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Salicaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruits are bright red berries that mature in the fall and are an important food source for various wildlife species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
